abstracts.cdata!:
The Power Sector Modernization
            Project's outcome is rated as satisfactory. Key lessons
            learned from this project include: 1) Early commitments of
            financing sources and advance procurement are key factors
            for expediting project implementation. In this case, early
            negotiation and approval of co-financing required for the
            Tablada thermal power plant, and awarding of the
            corresponding construction contract before loan approval
            permitted UTE (National Power and Transmission Company) to
            install quickly a thermal power plant compensating for low
            hydroelectric generation in years of dry hydrology. 2) A
            twinning arrangement with a foreign utility is an effective
            method to reorganize and modernize the management and
            operational practices, and associated training and
            computerized tools of a local power utility. 3) In a
            relatively small country, a power utility owned technical
            training center equipped with appropriate laboratories and
            meeting facilities is an effective tool to improve the
            skills of personnel in charge of doing maintenance and
            operation of power distribution systems. 4) Cumbersome
            processes at company and government levels for procurement
            of equipment and services are major obstacles introducing
            exorbitant delays in project implementation. 5) A project
            executing unit, inserted with the existing organization of
            the borrower, with its own competent staff, and supported
            with services from the rest of the organization, is an
            effective way to carry out a project.

abstracts.cdata!:
The project aims to ensure suitable
            electricity service at least cost and to modernize
            UTE's management to improve efficiency.  Project
            objectives include : a) improving the reliability of meeting
            short to medium term electricity demand; and b) improving
            sector efficiency by improving UTE's managerial
            capability and reducing losses.  As part of UTE's
            investment program for 1990-97, the project will include the
            following components : 1) installation of a new thermal
            plant (powered by two gas turbines of 113.5 MW each),
            including spare parts, control house, substation,
            interconnection to the existing transmission system, fuel
            pipeline and tanks; 2) improvements in the Montevideo power
            distribution network consisting of rehabilitation of the
            medium and low voltage system to increase the reliability of
            service to customers, as well as reduce the actual level of
            technical losses; and 3) implementation of an Institutional
            Development Program (IDP) consisting of : i) technical
            assistance for developing adequate procedures, management
            training and software transfer through a corporate twinning
            arrangement; ii) purchasing and setting up equipment to
            support the above; and iii) a training program including the
            rehabilitation of UTE's training center for technicians
            and skilled workers.
